Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using SH-SY5Y cells expressing wild-type or mutant SNCA.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased α-synuclein aggregation and reduced protein turnover for the p.G35R variant.
Enhanced fibrillization and neurotoxicity for the p.G38R variant compared to wild-type.
Increased oligomerization and mitochondrial dysfunction for the p.G42R variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis of protein aggregation levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels ≤ 20% compared to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels ≥ 50% compared to wild-type.

Material used.Description: Immunofluorescence was performed on brain tissue from transgenic mice expressing mutant SNCA variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Accumulation of α-synuclein in Lewy body-like inclusions in the substantia nigra.
Increased neuronal loss in the striatum and enhanced α-synuclein phosphorylation.
Widespread neuronal degeneration and α-synuclein aggregation in the cortex.

Biological replicates.Description: Five transgenic mice per group were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each brain section was imaged in quadruplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Brain tissue from wild-type mice was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Brain tissue from non-transgenic mice was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare fluorescence intensity between wild-type and mutant groups.

Material used.Description: Protein degradation rates were measured in HEK293 cells expressing mutant or wild-type SNCA.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced proteasomal degradation of p.G35R mutant α-synuclein compared to wild-type.
Impaired autophagy-mediated clearance of p.G38R mutant α-synuclein.

Readout description.Result意图: Increased ubiquitination and slower degradation kinetics for p.G42R mutant α-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Four biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Kruskal-Wallis test was used to compare degradation rates between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein degradation rate ≥ 70% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein degradation rate ≤ 30% of wild-type levels.
